channel.title: Blog on Tommy Cao
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Tommy Cao

item.title: CS50x - Week 2 Review
item.description: CS50 Week 2 Status: Done. Lecture: This week, the lecture explored how code is compiled by process of how compilers preprocess, compile, assemble and link the code to create executable programs. Other things I learned include: An introduction to visualising memory, variables and arrays. Rubber duck debugging. Array initialisation/referencing and parallels with char data type. The arguments argc + argv and how they can be used within programs, contrasting those with so far that had argument void.

item.title: CS50x - Week 1 Review
item.description: CS50 Week 1 Status: Done Lecture: The week’s lecture touched on the concept of good practices, as well as expanding on logic introduced with the code-blocks, with their respective C language implementations. I had knowledge of concepts such as data types, variables and use of the CLI but chose to not skip through any of the content — part of the reason I wanted to do an introductory course was so I could clear any misunderstandings I might hold, in generally start with a fresh perspective anyway.

item.title: CS50x - Week 0 Review
item.description: As I am still taking my first formative steps in my IT career, I find myself constantly curious on everything there is out there to learn. Consistently, there seems to be a single skill that is universally valued for it’s meaningful utility — programming. I found the CS50x course while looking for a course that would provide an effective foundation, and since there seems to be a universal agreement on the quality of this course, I figured it perfectly suitable.

item.title: First Blog Post!
item.description: Not super sure what I have planned for this website – but I figure it’s better to do, experiment, and start defining things later when I develop better experience and opinions. For now, it’s a learning blog and portfolio website!
